Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the negative effects of the health care law on businesses and the economy by stating that businesses across the country are raising prices or cutting jobs as a result of the added cost.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide enough evidence or support to back up the statement that national studies are already showing the negative effects of the health care law on businesses and the economy.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the added cost of the health care law is directly causing businesses to raise prices or cut jobs, without considering other factors that may contribute to these actions.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert questions the claim and suggests that there may be alternative explanations for businesses raising prices or cutting jobs, such as other regulations or factors unrelated to the health care law.
